thread.title: Falling $A,lower costs boost Newcrest

title: Falling $A,lower costs boost Newcrest
text:
Thu, Jul 23, 2015, 9:54 AM AEST - Australia Markets open in 6 mins. Falling $A,lower costs boost Newcrest AAP – 9 minutes ago Print 
Newcrest Mining has lifted its profit margins thanks to lower production costs and a weaker Australian dollar. 
The gold miner made an average profit of $533 per ounce of gold sold during the 2014/15 financial year, up from $432 an ounce the previous year. 
The result was driven by a four per cent cut in production costs and the sliding Australian dollar, which saw the group receive an average price of $1,532 an ounce during the June quarter, up from $1408 an ounce during the 2014 financial year. 
That's despite a slide in global gold prices, which dropped from $US1,325 an ounce to to $1,175 during the year. 
The company produced 2.42 million ounces of gold during the year, up one per cent compared to the 2013/14. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Leaders agree to end GST-free online goods AAP
